poem:
Title: "The Caucus Morning"

In the raw of morning,
beneath the shell of Iowa's pale sky -
the candidates, like plump pears,
we pare down.
The red, ripe heart each reveals,
now flocked by voters,
an autumn of decisions.
In this electoral fruit bowl,
each name dropped is
a fruity echo,
an invitation to the November feast
where winner takes all.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Iowa caucus 2024: who are the Republican presidential candidates? default The Republican race for the 2024 presidential nomination began with a surprisingly large field but has rapidly winnowed down. Now voters are flocking to the Iowa caucuses – the first contest in the process. In a US election, Republican and Democrats hold contests in each state to decide who their nominee will be in the presidential election in November. The winner in each state gets". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
